article: For 52 years my father got up every morning at 5:30 a.m., except Sunday, and went to work. I _ saw my father home from work ill. He had no hobbies, except taking care of his family. For 22 years, _ I left home for college, my father _ me every Sunday at 9:00 a.m.. He was always interested in my _ ,or how my family was doing, and I never once heard him _ about his lot in life. The calls even came when he and my mother were in other states. Nine years ago when I _ my first house, my father, 67 years old, spent three days _ my house. He would not _ me to pay someone to have it done. All he _ was a cup of tea, a paint brush and to talk to him. But I was too _ .I had a law practice to run, and I could not take _ to hold the brush, or talk to my father. _ things happened several times later. The morning on Sunday. January 16, 1996, my father telephoned me as usual ,this time from my sister's home in Florida. But the _ came again at 4:40 p.m. that day. My father was in the _ in Florida with an aneurysm .I got on an airplane _ , and on the way, I _ of all the times I had not taken the time to talk to my father. I determined that when I arrived, I would make up for the lost time, and have a nice long talk with him. I arrived in Florida at 11:30 p.m., my father had passed away at 9:12 p.m.. This time it was he who did not have time to talk, or to wait for me.
